name: Oriental Bay Owl
description: A small owl with a stocky appearance and an unusually shaped facial disc around large dark eyes—elongated upwards, making the head appear square and large relative to the body. It has short, rounded wings. Its coloration is brown-beige, with a whitish underbelly.
image_alt: Oriental Bay Owl, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
attractions: The tropical Oriental Bay Owl is one of the few owls capable of climbing vertical tree trunks. From there, it watches for prey, which it then catches in flight. It has a peculiar call resembling the sounds of a cat fight, but it only vocalizes during the breeding season.
breeding: This species is rarely seen in European zoos; we’ve had it in Prague since spring 2012.
